definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
ruling a large nation is like cooking a small delicacy (idiom)/effective government requires minimal intervention
pinyin: zhi4 da4 guo2 ruo4 peng1 xiao3 xian1

sentences.english: Russia, a major oil producer, is unlikely to embrace any ambitious emissions reductions.
sentences.chinese: 產油大國俄羅斯不太可能歡迎任何大幅減排計劃。

sentences.english: The link is the growing strain on the world"s sole superpower. America is locked into a draining and demoralising war."
sentences.chinese: 這個聯繫就是全球唯一超級大國面臨的壓力日益增加。

sentences.english: Beutiful photos and very powerful representation of a great Nation.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的圖片，這也是對一個大國的強有力的展示。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is important to implant them the conciousness of a responsible great power.
sentences.chinese: 因此對他們灌輸開放負責的大國意識是十分必要的。

sentences.english: Both countries are nuclear powers and are keenly aware that a conventional military conflict would not be easily contained.
sentences.chinese: 兩國都是核大國，都很清楚傳統的軍事衝突不易控制。

sentences.english: This is a vast nation like China would let the Sri Lankan bully?
sentences.chinese: 中國這泱泱大國還會讓這斯欺負？

sentences.english: The war demonstrates the duality of the anti-terrorism campaign and the strength of superpowers.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭顯示了超級大國反恐的兩重性及力量的兩重性。

sentences.english: These small states leagued against the powerful nation that threatened their independence .
sentences.chinese: 這些小國家聯合起來反對威脅它們獨立的那個大國。

sentences.english: Britain and China were drinking tea large country, there are tea culture phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 中英兩國皆爲飲茶大國，都存在茶文化現象。

sentences.english: Vietnamese know how to kick out of big countries .
sentences.chinese: 越南人知道如何狠揍大國。

sentences.english: The answer is that they appropriated much of the wealth of a collapsing superpower.
sentences.chinese: 答案是他們侵吞了一個崩潰的超級大國的大量財富。

sentences.english: He was also the last good king of Judah.
sentences.chinese: 他也是猶大國最後的一位好王。

sentences.english: Next week, leaders of theworldworld's largest economies will meet in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
sentences.chinese: 下週，世界經濟大國會在賓夕凡尼亞州的匹茲堡會談。

sentences.english: In an age of globalisation, global powers have to be economic titans.
sentences.chinese: 在一個全球化的時代，世界大國還應是經濟巨人。

sentences.english: Among great powers, Russia is the only country where “old friends” hardly appeared.
sentences.chinese: 在大國中，俄羅斯是“老朋友”幾近於無的國家。

sentences.english: China is very different from most examples of rising powers through history.
sentences.chinese: 中國明顯不同於歷史長河中崛起的多數大國。

definition: abbr. for 國民大會|国民大会, National Assembly of the Republic of China (extant during various periods between 1913 and 2005)/abbr. for 新加坡國立大學|新加坡国立大学, National University of Singapore (NUS)/abbr. for 印度國民大會黨|印度国民大会党, Indian National Congress (INC)/abbr. for 馬來西亞印度國民大會黨|马来西亚印度国民大会党, Malaysian Indian Congress (MIC)
Europe/abbr. for 歐羅巴洲|欧罗巴洲[Ou1 luo2 ba1 Zhou1]
